required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BMS-936558 (MDX-1106) In Subjects With Advanced/Metastatic Clear-Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Blinded, Phase 2 Dose-Ranging Study Of BMS-936558 (MDX-1106) In Subjects With Progressive, Advanced/Metastatic Clear-Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma Who Have Received Prior Anti-Angiogenic Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure how active BMS-936558 (nivolumab) is against Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC) as measured by the disease not progressing and whether a dose response relationship exists.

primary_outcome.measure: Median Progression Free Survival (PFS) at Primary Endpoint - Randomized Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until after approximately 116 events (disease progression or death), approximately 2 years.
primary_outcome.description: PFS: time from randomization to date of first disease progression (either clinical or radiographic progression, as assessed by the investigator) and measured in Months. Tumor assessments (radiographic scans) were done every 6 weeks from randomization for the first 12 months, then every 12 weeks until progression. Survival was assessed every 3 months. The analysis of PFS was conducted after approximately 116 events (progression or death), approximately 2 years. PFS was calculated based on investigator's assessment of first date of progression (either clinical or radiographic progression) or date of death if progression did not occur. Progression was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of the longest target lesions since screening (the sum must be an absolute increase of at least 5 mm), or measurable increase in non-target lesion or appearance of one or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) at Primary Endpoint- Randomized Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until after approximately 116 events (disease progression or death), approximately 2 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor response was evaluated by investigator according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the number of responders divided by the number of randomized participants; Responders=complete response (CR) or partial response (PR). CR: disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) must have reduction in short axis to < 10 mm; PR: at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. ORR was estimated along with exact 80% Confidence Interval (CI) using the Clopper and Pearson method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Best Overall Response at Primary Endpoint - Randomized Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until after approximately 116 events (disease progression or death), approximately 2 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Best response defined as the best response across all time points. Primary endpoint=116 events, approximately 2 years. Tumor response was evaluated by investigator according to RECIST version 1.1. Complete Response (CR): disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) must have reduction in short axis to < 10 mm; partial response (PR): at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters; Disease Progression (PD) was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of the longest target lesions since screening (the sum must be an absolute increase of at least 5 mm), or measurable increase in non-target lesion or appearance of one or more new lesions; Stable disease: neither shrinkage to qualify for PR or increase to qualify for PD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Overall Survival in Months at Interim Data Cut-off - Randomized Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Randomization to approximately 4 years post randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Median Overall Survival (OS), measured in months, was based on Kaplan Meier estimates.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Progression Free Survival (PFS) in Months at Interim Data Cut-off - Randomized Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Randomization to approximately 4 years post randomization
secondary_outcome.description: PFS: the time from randomization to the date of first disease progression (either clinical or radiographic progression, as assessed by the investigator) was measured in Months. Tumor assessments (radiographic scans) were done every 6 weeks from randomization for the first 12 months, then every 12 weeks until progression. PFS was calculated based on investigator's assessment of first date of progression (either clinical or radiographic progression) or date of death if progression did not occur. Participants were censored if they had not experienced disease progression (they were still on treatment or in follow-up) or had received subsequent cancer therapy. Disease Progression was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of the longest target lesions since screening (the sum must be an absolute increase of at least 5 mm), or measurable increase in non-target lesion or appearance of one or more new lesions.

intervention.description: Solution, Intravenous (IV), 0.3 mg/kg, every 3 weeks (Q 3 weeks), Until Progressive disease (PD), toxicity or discontinue for other reasons
Solution, Intravenous (IV), 2.0 mg/kg, every 3 weeks (Q 3 weeks), Until Progressive disease (PD), toxicity or discontinue for other reasons
Solution, Intravenous (IV), 10.0 mg/kg, every 3 weeks (Q 3 weeks), Until Progressive disease (PD), toxicity or discontinue for other reasons

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologic confirmation of Renal cell carcinoma (RCC) with a clear cell component
- Previous treatment with at least one anti-angiogenic agent
- Progressed within 6 months of study enrollment
- Subjects should not have had more than 3 prior treatments for locally advanced or metastatic disease
- Must have available tumor tissue for submission
- Subjects must also meet various laboratory parameters for inclusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with any active autoimmune disease or a history of known autoimmune disease

facility.name: Northwestern University Feinberg School Of Medicine
Indiana University Health Melvin And Bren Simon Cancer Center
Masonic Cancer Ctr, University Of Minnesota
North Mississippi Hematology And Oncology Associates, Ltd
Centre Hospitalier Universitaire De Montreal-Notre-Dame Hosp

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 198 participants enrolled and 168 were randomized to study drug: 27 were not randomized to a study arm because they no longer met criteria and 3 were not randomized because the participants withdrew consent.

outcome.title: Median Progression Free Survival (PFS) at Primary Endpoint - Randomized Population
outcome.description: PFS: time from randomization to date of first disease progression (either clinical or radiographic progression, as assessed by the investigator) and measured in Months. Tumor assessments (radiographic scans) were done every 6 weeks from randomization for the first 12 months, then every 12 weeks until progression. Survival was assessed every 3 months. The analysis of PFS was conducted after approximately 116 events (progression or death), approximately 2 years. PFS was calculated based on investigator’s assessment of first date of progression (either clinical or radiographic progression) or date of death if progression did not occur. Progression was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of the longest target lesions since screening (the sum must be an absolute increase of at least 5 mm), or measurable increase in non-target lesion or appearance of one or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization until after approximately 116 events (disease progression or death), approximately 2 years.
outcome.population: All participants who were randomized to a treatment arm.

measure.title: Median Progression Free Survival (PFS) at Primary Endpoint - Randomized Population
measure.description: PFS: time from randomization to date of first disease progression (either clinical or radiographic progression, as assessed by the investigator) and measured in Months. Tumor assessments (radiographic scans) were done every 6 weeks from randomization for the first 12 months, then every 12 weeks until progression. Survival was assessed every 3 months. The analysis of PFS was conducted after approximately 116 events (progression or death), approximately 2 years. PFS was calculated based on investigator’s assessment of first date of progression (either clinical or radiographic progression) or date of death if progression did not occur. Progression was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of the longest target lesions since screening (the sum must be an absolute increase of at least 5 mm), or measurable increase in non-target lesion or appearance of one or more new lesions.
measure.population: All participants who were randomized to a treatment arm.

analysis.p_value_desc: Stratified log rank trend test with 20% significance level (2-sided)

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR) at Primary Endpoint- Randomized Population
outcome.description: Tumor response was evaluated by investigator according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the number of responders divided by the number of randomized participants; Responders=complete response (CR) or partial response (PR). CR: disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) must have reduction in short axis to < 10 mm; PR: at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. ORR was estimated along with exact 80% Confidence Interval (CI) using the Clopper and Pearson method.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization until after approximately 116 events (disease progression or death), approximately 2 years.
outcome.population: All randomized participants were analyzed up to Primary endpoint, approximately 2 years.

measure.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR) at Primary Endpoint- Randomized Population
measure.description: Tumor response was evaluated by investigator according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. Objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the number of responders divided by the number of randomized participants; Responders=complete response (CR) or partial response (PR). CR: disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) must have reduction in short axis to < 10 mm; PR: at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. ORR was estimated along with exact 80% Confidence Interval (CI) using the Clopper and Pearson method.
measure.population: All randomized participants were analyzed up to Primary endpoint, approximately 2 years.

analysis.p_value_desc: Exact Cochran-Armitage trend test with 20% significance level (2-sided).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Best Overall Response at Primary Endpoint - Randomized Population
outcome.description: Best response defined as the best response across all time points. Primary endpoint=116 events, approximately 2 years. Tumor response was evaluated by investigator according to RECIST version 1.1. Complete Response (CR): disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) must have reduction in short axis to < 10 mm; partial response (PR): at least 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters; Disease Progression (PD) was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of the longest target lesions since screening (the sum must be an absolute increase of at least 5 mm), or measurable increase in non-target lesion or appearance of one or more new lesions; Stable disease: neither shrinkage to qualify for PR or increase to qualify for PD.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization until after approximately 116 events (disease progression or death), approximately 2 years.
outcome.population: All Randomized participants were summarized up to Primary endpoint data cut off, approximately 2 years.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
